page.title: 01MAUCHLINE AND NORTHWARDS
page.content: Apart from the portion of Mauchline Village which falls within this area (approximately one kilometre square) this is almost totally intensively managed grassland, supporting dairy farms. There is no industry, the last pit having closed several years ago. Those in employment mainly travel daily, using good road links with Ayr, Kilmarnock and Cumnock. The remnant of the mining community work in nearby Barony and Killock which are deemed to have a limited lifespan. Housing is a combination of private and council owned. This sector includes the bukk of Old Mauchline. Housing development to the south indicates Mauchline could become a dormitory area for more heavily rate-paying coastal towns. Population contains broad social mix, actively supporting variety of organisations. Many reminders exist of
